creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: head and torso of a man with a moustache and receding hairline, holding a pen-like tool in his PL hand; many diagonal hatched lines; man wears jacket, tie and vest; sketchy style
marks:
Signature, Date, Label

in graphite on verso of  signed and dated in brown ink, lower right: [Lovis
medium: Pen and brown ink on cream wove Japanese paper
provenance: Allan Frumkin Gallery, New York until 1966; bought by Andrus at Mia-organized loan exhibition and show; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; Elizabeth Andrus, Wayzata, Minn.
title: Self-Portrait
